This is the kind of film one watches in gape-jawed, horrified silence, and yet continues to watch, mesmerized, as if watching a car wreck - and then remains waiting for the next axe blow. As it turns out, there were so many viewers like myself at the screening I attended, that several, during the very last crucial scene, had tears streaming down their faces. That's quite a grasp Tomas Alfredson has on the elements of human emotion.

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to this hybrid England/Australian production.
But there are a number of unsuccessful attempts to pack in too many characters - and try to explore the dynamics of a family.
This film would make an excellent mini-series but, by trying to cover too much in two hours, it feels "bolted together"

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all over the place and several skeletons and bodies half eaten. So what are they going to do next? That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie in a theater..

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, Jerry MEA Culpa, Tom. Originally a Dante Basco's 8 minute payback film distributed under Metro Goldwyn Mayer. Only one recent restoration produced by the cartoon department for cut development. Not a box office flop but did well for the times

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more recent Disney fairy tales, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to me is that the picture was duplicated and dubbed in other languages, like in many “Ameriphobe” movies, looking like a piece of propaganda and cheapening the movie. But this is a rant

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures in the countless empires that make up the Galaxy beyond. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is the first of three AVENGING FORCE films, all of which are based on the TV series.
